 This function is used to call back the network application to allocate a packet descriptor with packet buffer allocated from the application packet queue.Registered with driver at time of emac_open.
 
typedef void EMAC_FREE_PKT_CALLBACK_FN_T(uint32_t port_num, EMAC_PKT_DESC_T *p_desc)
 This function is used to call back the network application to free a packet descriptor to the application packet queue. Registered with driver at time of emac_open.

 This function is used to call back the network application when a management message response is received from ICSSG FW. Registered with driver at time of emac_open.

Detailed Description

EMAC driver interface.

This API header file should be included in an application as follows:

#include <ti/drv/emac/emac_drv.h>

Macro Definition Documentation

#define EMAC_LINKSTATUS_FD10   ((uint32_t)3U)

Link Status: Full Duplex 10Mbps

#define EMAC_LINKSTATUS_FD100   ((uint32_t)5U)

Link Status: Full Duplex 100Mbps

#define EMAC_LINKSTATUS_FD1000   ((uint32_t)7U)

Link Status: Full Duplex 1000Mbps

#define EMAC_LINKSTATUS_HD10   ((uint32_t)2U)

Link Status: Half Duplex 10Mbps

#define EMAC_LINKSTATUS_HD100   ((uint32_t)4U)

Link Status: Half Duplex 100Mbps

#define EMAC_LINKSTATUS_NOLINK   ((uint32_t)0U)

Link Status: No Link

#define EMAC_PKT_FLAG_EOP   0x40000000U

End of packet flag indication in Flags field of EMAC_PKT_DESC_T

Note
Not applicable for am65xx SOC
#define EMAC_PKT_FLAG_SOP   0x80000000U

Start of packet flag indication in Flags field of EMAC_PKT_DESC_T

Note
Not applicable for am65xx SOC
#define EMAC_PKT_FLAG_TX_TS_REQ   0x20000000U

Transmit packet timestamp request in Flags field of EMAC_PKT_DESC_T

Note
ONLY supported for am65xx SOC
#define EMAC_PKTFLT_ALL   5

Receive filter set to receive All packets

#define EMAC_PKTFLT_ALLMULTICAST   4

Receive filter set to receive alll Mcast/Bcast/Ucast packets

#define EMAC_PKTFLT_BROADCAST   2

Receive filter set to receive broadcast/unitcast packets

#define EMAC_PKTFLT_DIRECT   1

Receive filter set to receive direct unitcast packets

#define EMAC_PKTFLT_MULTICAST   3

Receive filter set to receive multicast/broadcast/unitcast packets

#define EMAC_PKTFLT_NOTHING   0

Receive filter set to receive no packets

Typedef Documentation

typedef uint32_t EMAC_PKT_FLAG_T

Specification of EMAC_PKT_FLAG_T.

The EMAC_PKT_FLAG_T is used to provide packet flags in Flags field of EMAC_PKT_DESC_T at time of emac_send API.

typedef uint32_t EMAC_PktFilter_T

Packet Filtering.

Receive Packet Filtering Settings

Function Documentation

const char* emac_get_version ( void  )

Retrieves the version ID string.

Returns
Pointer of the version ID string
EMAC_DRV_ERR_E emac_int_service ( uint32_t  port_num,
bool  rx_flag 
)

Services RX or TX interrupt for an opened EMAC port.

The calling application must supply a valid port number and RX/TX flag. The driver will service the interrupt and call back to application layer when there is a packet received.

Parameters
port_numEMAC port number
rx_flagURE: RX interrupt; FALSE: TX interrupt
Returns
Returns EMAC_DRV_RESULT_OK on success,EMAC_DRV_RESULT_ISR_ERR on failure
Precondition
emac_open must be called prior to calling this API
